23.heading: Flip Animation.
23.title: Comic Book Character : Unleashing the Hero in Us All
23.author: David A

contents.title: Introduction : We could be heroes
Let the weak say "I am strong" : Spider-man, Superman & the Incredible Hulk
Vengeance is mine : Batman, the Joker & the Punisher
X-cursus : heroes in the hands of a professional
You cannot see my face : costumes & secret identities
Everyone was beautiful & nothing hurt : body image, agelessness, death
God loves, man kills : gender, race & the X-Men
X-cursus : superheroes & grownup fanboys
My country 'tis of thee : Captain America & the truth
Might makes right : the Justice League meets the Avengers
Gods walk the earth : demi-gods, Daredevil & the problem of religion
Evil is as evil does : Lex Luthor, Magneto & Galactus
Holy case study! Superman versus Jesus
Conclusion : Becoming super
Appendix: How to read a comic book.

notes: Book on superhero comic books and Christian ethics.

156.heading: Flirtations.
156.title: "The Mercenary"
156.author: by Segrelles
156.appears_in: p. 8-15 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 9 (Dec. 1981).
notes: "Having saved the damsel in distress, the Mercenary fled on his newborn saurian. Young and weak, the bird dropped them on a nearby cliff, unable to carry them an further. They decided to camp there for the night, but when the Mercenary would not yield to the woman's flirtations, she became outraged. The following morning, he returned her to her home."

159.author: Alison Bechdel
159.appears_in: p. 74-75 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger has indulged in flirtatious behavior at the national lesbian conference, and says it's nothing; then Malika sends her roses. The cigar-smoking, anchor-tatooed delivery man says, "A Ginger Jordan live here, Sonny?" To which Lois replies, "Yes, she does! Thank you kindly, Ma'm!"
